Label: Datum
Definition IGN: Parameter or set of parameters that define the position of the origin, the scale and the orientation of a coordinate system. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, part 10.1, table 33 and annex B.3.
Definition ISO: parameter or set of parameters that realize the position of the origin, the scale, and the orientation of a coordinate system

Definition IGN: Datum describing the relation of a two- or three-dimensional coordinate system to the Earth. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, part 10.2, table 34 and annex B.3.2.
Definition ISO: reference frame or datum describing the relationship of a two- or three-dimensional coordinate system to the Earth

Definition IGN: Meridian from which the longitudes of other meridians are quantified. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, part 10.2.1, table 35 and annex B.3.2.2.
Definition ISO: meridian from which the longitudes of other meridians are quantified

Definition IGN: Surface formed by the rotation of an ellipse about its minor axis, defined by a semi-major axis and a flattening parameter and fairly geocentric. NB : It is a mathematical model of the geoid, i.e. the Earth without its relief. Many geodetic ellipsoids exist. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, part 10.2.2, table 36 and annex B.3.2.3.
Datum describing the relation of gravity-related heights or depths to the Earth. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, table 41 and annex B.3.3.
Definition ISO: reference frame describing the relation of gravity-related heights or depths to the Earth
datum describing the relationship of a coordinate system to a local reference
datum describing the relationship of a temporal coordinate system to an object
group of multiple realizations of the same terrestrial or vertical reference system that, for approximate spatial referencing purposes, are not significantly different
